text: The Southern Cameroons Broadcasting Corporation (SCBC TV) is an Anglophone Cameroonian television channel that has been transmitting since 6 May 2017. == History == The Southern Cameroons Broadcasting Corporation (SCBC TV), is a channel primarily focused on the history and culture of the peoples of the English-speaking regions of Cameroon, interviews with exiled leaders and documentaries on human rights abuses in these regions. It started on 6 May 2017 and is currently based in South Africa. The Cameroonian government wanted to shut down the channel because of its reports on the Anglophone Crisis. ==References== Category:2017 establishments in Africa Category:Ambazonia
